channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024070647
item.description:
Report E-2024070647

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, two (2) 5-liter pails of UN3149 were punctured in transit and released approximately 1-2 gallons of product to the trailer interior and cardboard boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer and containerized all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070649
item.description:
Report E-2024070649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1987 was crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) ounce of product to the top of the pail. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pail of UN1987 denatured alcohol was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was labeled appropriately and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024070495
item.description:
Report E-2024070495

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11, 2024, seventy-two (72) 1-gallon jugs of UN1791 were crushed in transit and released approximately sixty (60) gallons of product to the trailer interior, adjacent freight, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and degreasing agent to remediate the impacted site. The damaged jugs were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. All impacted materials were contained in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Xylol was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by XAU. Product has already evaporated. The release impacted trailer #3113649. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

  • Description: On 06/10/2024, during cruise phase of flight DL75 (AMS-ATL), a passenger's vape pen wÂ¿s observed to be warm and smoking. The device was placed in bucket and submerged in water. The vape smoke was mitigated. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No flight crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.U
